trans-unit.source: Operation not allowed from current location
trans-unit.target: Operation not allowed from current location

trans-unit.source: The Mozilla VPN is successfully installed. You’re ready to start taking control of your online privacy.
trans-unit.target: The Mozilla VPN is successfully installed. You’re ready to start taking control of your online privacy.

trans-unit.source: A previous installation of Mozilla VPN exists at /Applications/Mozilla VPN.app. This installer will remove the previous installation prior to installing. Please back up any data before proceeding.
trans-unit.target: A previous installation of Mozilla VPN exists at /Applications/Mozilla VPN.app. This installer will remove the previous installation prior to installing. Please back up any data before proceeding.

trans-unit.source: Mozilla VPN requires Mac OS X 10.6 or later.
trans-unit.target: Mozilla VPN requires macOS 10.6 or later.

trans-unit.source: You will now be guided through the installation steps for the Mozilla VPN. Thank you for choosing your VPN from the trusted pioneer of internet privacy.
trans-unit.target: You will now be guided through the installation steps for the Mozilla VPN. Thank you for choosing your VPN from the trusted pioneer of internet privacy.

trans-unit.note: This refers to the current IP address, i.e. "IP: Loading".

trans-unit.source: Unable to establish a connection at this time. We’re working hard to resolve the issue. Please try again shortly.
trans-unit.target: Unable to establish a connection at this time. We’re working hard to resolve the issue. Please try again shortly.

trans-unit.note: Main text telling the user that we are asking for permission to send a crash report.
trans-unit.source: The Mozilla VPN app quit unexpectedly. Would you like to send a crash report to help fix the issue?
trans-unit.target: The Mozilla VPN app quit unexpectedly. Would you like to send a crash report to help fix the issue?

trans-unit.note: User does not agree to send a crash report.
Label over description text section.
User agrees to send a crash report.
Example: "deviceName deviceDescription"

Select the Location of the VPN server

trans-unit.source: Turn on to protect your privacy
trans-unit.target: Turn on to protect your privacy

trans-unit.target: Get notified if a guest Wi-Fi portal is blocked due to VPN connection

trans-unit.target: Get notified when the connection status changes

trans-unit.target: Get notified if you connect to an unsecured Wi-Fi network

Search bar placeholder text

trans-unit.source: Your connection will not be secure while you update.
trans-unit.target: Your connection will not be secure while you update.

trans-unit.source: Please update the app before you continue to use the VPN
trans-unit.target: Please update the app before you continue to use the VPN

trans-unit.source: We detected and fixed a serious bug. You must update your app.
trans-unit.target: We detected and fixed a serious bug. You must update your app.

trans-unit.note: A notification channel; so the user can subscribe to "General Notifications"
Accessible name for a button. %1 is the version number of the VPN client.
Refers to the installed version. For example: 'Release Version: 1.23'

Used by screen readers to explain to users which item they are currently focused on, and how many items there are total in a group. For example, given a list with 15 items. If a user selects the 3rd item, we want the screen reader to read out "3 of 15". The %1 represents the index of the currently focused item by the screen reader. The %2 represents the total number of items in the group.
Used by screen reader to indicate that a user action selected an item.

Used by screen readers to denote that a particular item is currently selected. For example, given a segmented control with 2 items, where the first item is currently selected. We want the screen reader to read out "Selected, <item name>". The %1 represents the name of the selected item.
Make sure it's clear that this will allow major features (like messaging apps) to function, but potentially at the expense of some security.
trans-unit.source: Allow RCS/MMS messaging, Apple features like CarPlay and AirDrop, and connections to local devices. May reduce network security.
trans-unit.target: Allow RCS/MMS messaging, Apple features like CarPlay and AirDrop, and connections to local devices. May reduce network security.

trans-unit.source: VPN must be off to change this setting
trans-unit.target: VPN must be off to change this setting

trans-unit.source: You must turn off your VPN in order to see the portal, and turn it back on once you have logged in.
trans-unit.target: You must turn off your VPN in order to see the portal, and turn it back on once you have logged in.

trans-unit.source: You can turn on your VPN once you have gained internet access by logging in to the portal.
trans-unit.target: You can turn on your VPN once you have gained internet access by logging in to the portal.

trans-unit.source: A captive portal is when the guest Wi-Fi you are using requires you to log in to get internet access.
trans-unit.target: A captive portal is when the guest Wi-Fi you are using requires you to log in to get internet access.

trans-unit.note: Accessible label for the button that shows the IP info panel when clicked.

Body label for the devices help sheet
trans-unit.source: Adding a new device to your subscription is easy: just download and log in to Mozilla VPN on that device.
trans-unit.target: Adding a new device to your subscription is easy: just download and log in to Mozilla VPN on that device.

trans-unit.note: Body label for the devices help sheet
trans-unit.source: To remove one of your added devices, select “Edit” on this screen and use the trash icon to remove the device you no longer want to use Mozilla VPN on.
trans-unit.target: To remove one of your added devices, select “Edit” on this screen and use the trash icon to remove the device you no longer want to use Mozilla VPN on.

trans-unit.note: Header label for the devices help sheet
Title label for the devices help sheet
Body text for the custom dns help sheet
trans-unit.source: Whenever you connect to a website, a DNS (domain name system) first turns the domain name (e.g. www.mozilla.org) into an IP address that allows your internet traffic to reach that destination.
trans-unit.target: Whenever you connect to a website, a DNS (domain name system) first turns the domain name (e.g. www.mozilla.org) into an IP address that allows your internet traffic to reach that destination.

trans-unit.note: Body text for the custom dns help sheet
trans-unit.source: Mozilla VPN allows you to choose a custom DNS server if you prefer. If you use one, you won’t be able to use other privacy features in the VPN like tracker blocking.
trans-unit.target: Mozilla VPN allows you to choose a custom DNS server if you prefer. If you use one, you won’t be able to use other privacy features in the VPN like tracker blocking.

trans-unit.note: Header label for the custom dns help sheet
Title label for the custom dns help sheet
Body label for the excluded apps help sheet
trans-unit.source: Excluded apps let you turn off VPN protection for specific apps, without turning off VPN protection for your entire device.
trans-unit.target: Excluded apps let you turn off VPN protection for specific apps, without turning off VPN protection for your entire device.

trans-unit.note: Body label for the excluded apps help sheet
trans-unit.source: When you exclude an app, it will have access to your IP address and approximate location.
trans-unit.target: When you exclude an app, it will have access to your IP address and approximate location.

trans-unit.note: Body label for the excluded apps help sheet
trans-unit.source: You can use the settings under Settings > Privacy features to block ads, block trackers, and block malware, even on excluded apps.
trans-unit.target: You can use the settings under Settings > Privacy features to block ads, block trackers, and block malware, even on excluded apps.

trans-unit.note: Label for button that opens the "Privacy features" view from the excluded apps help sheet
Header label for the excluded apps help sheet
Title label for the excluded apps help sheet
Body label for the location selection help sheet
trans-unit.source: If you want maximum speed and reliability, choose one of the recommended locations in the “Single-hop” toggle. We’ve sorted them based on expected performance.
trans-unit.target: If you want maximum speed and reliability, choose one of the recommended locations in the “Single-hop” toggle. We’ve sorted them based on expected performance.

trans-unit.note: Body label for the location selection help sheet
trans-unit.source: If you want to add more privacy, switch to “Multi-hop” and add an additional server location. Multi-hop VPN routes your traffic through two server locations instead of one for extra security and privacy. This may also slow down your connection a bit.
trans-unit.target: If you want to add more privacy, switch to “Multi-hop” and add an additional server location. Multi-hop VPN routes your traffic through two server locations instead of one for extra security and privacy. This may also slow down your connection a bit.

trans-unit.note: Header label for the location selection help sheet
Title label for the location selection help sheet
Body label for the privacy features help sheet
trans-unit.source: Privacy features give you greater control over the types of content you see, helping you stay safe online.
trans-unit.target: Privacy features give you greater control over the types of content you see, helping you stay safe online.

trans-unit.note: Body label for the privacy features help sheet
trans-unit.source: If you activate these features, they’ll overwrite any custom DNS you’re using. These protections are not a substitute for taking other security precautions — for example, while blocking malware you should still avoid downloading attachments in strange emails.
trans-unit.target: If you activate these features, they’ll overwrite any custom DNS you’re using. These protections are not a substitute for taking other security precautions — for example, while blocking malware you should still avoid downloading attachments in strange emails.

trans-unit.note: Header label for the privacy features help sheet
trans-unit.source: What can privacy features do for me?
trans-unit.target: What can privacy features do for me?

trans-unit.note: Title label for the privacy features help sheet
Button a user clicks after updating their Mozilla account settings so that they can re-attempt sign-in
This is a label displayed on the password creation screen.
User has requested to send a new email containing the 6-digit pin to confirm their email address.
trans-unit.source: We’ve resent your code to your email.
trans-unit.target: We’ve resent your code to your email.

trans-unit.note: User has been sent a verification email containing a code.

trans-unit.target: Enter your email address to continue using Mozilla VPN

trans-unit.target: Finish creating your Mozilla account to continue to Mozilla VPN

Non-op text that informs user about how Mozilla will not sell it to a third party.

trans-unit.target: We only use your email to create your account or sign in. We will never sell it to a third party.

trans-unit.note: User provided did not provide a correct security code.

trans-unit.target: Email format not supported. Please try again with a different email

trans-unit.note: User has submitted an invalid password.
This is a hint for the user - they must provide a password with at least 8 characters
This is a hint for the user - password they provide must not be a common password. Ex. password.

trans-unit.target: Must not be a common password

trans-unit.note: This is a hint for the user - they must provide a password that does not match their email.
trans-unit.source: Must not be your email address
trans-unit.target: Must not be your email address

trans-unit.source: To continue, please confirm with your Mozilla account password.
trans-unit.target: To continue, please confirm with your Mozilla account password.

trans-unit.note: Title for app screen asking user for their security code.

User has been unable to sign in correctly, they have a cool down period of 1 minute until they can try again.

trans-unit.target: You’ve made too many attempts to sign in. You won’t be able to try again with this account for 1 minute.

trans-unit.note: User has been unable to sign in correctly, they have a cool down period of 15 minutes until they can try again.

trans-unit.target: You’ve made too many attempts to sign in. You won’t be able to try again with this account for 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Continue to Mozilla VPN by signing in with your Mozilla account
trans-unit.target: Continue to Mozilla VPN by signing in with your Mozilla account

User has tried to log in using an SSO-linked account that does not have a password. The user needs to log in to their Mozilla Account to set a password before proceeding.
trans-unit.source: To finish setting up your Mozilla account, create a password in your account settings:
trans-unit.target: To finish setting up your Mozilla account, create a password in your account settings:

trans-unit.target: 1. Go to Create password in your Mozilla account settings.

trans-unit.note: User has tried to log in using an SSO-linked account that does not have a password. The user needs to log in to their Mozilla Account to set a password before proceeding.
User has tried to log in using an SSO-linked account that does not have a password. The user needs to log in to their Mozilla Account to set a password before proceeding.
trans-unit.source: When your password is created, return to this screen and continue to sign in to Mozilla VPN.
trans-unit.target: When your password is created, return to this screen and continue to sign in to Mozilla VPN.

trans-unit.note: User has tried to log into a Mozilla account before setting their password, which happens after email verification. This is the header on the error screen.
User has tried to log into a Mozilla account before setting their password, which happens after email verification. %1 is the email address associated with the account.

trans-unit.target: We’ve sent an email to %1 with the verification link. Please follow the directions to set up your password and finish setting up your account.

trans-unit.note: A user trying to submit feedback will use this dropdown to select the general topic related to the feedback.

%1 is the name of the city the VPN disconnected from.

trans-unit.source: The guest Wi-Fi network you’re connected to requires action. Click to turn off VPN to see the portal.
trans-unit.target: The guest Wi-Fi network you’re connected to requires action. Click to turn off VPN to see the portal.

trans-unit.source: The guest Wi-Fi network you’re connected to may not be secure. Click to turn on VPN to secure your device.
trans-unit.target: The guest Wi-Fi network you’re connected to may not be secure. Click to turn on VPN to secure your device.

trans-unit.source: Sorry, something went wrong with your VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Sorry, something went wrong with your VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: Your Mozilla VPN subscription cannot be found. Please open the app to resolve this subscription issue.
trans-unit.target: Your Mozilla VPN subscription cannot be found. Please open the app to resolve this subscription issue.

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi network is not secure. Click here to turn on VPN and secure your device.
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi network is not secure. Click here to turn on VPN and secure your device.

trans-unit.note: %1 is the Wi-Fi network name
trans-unit.source: %1 is not secure. Click here to turn on VPN and secure your device.
trans-unit.target: %1 is not secure. Click here to turn on VPN and secure your device.

trans-unit.source: Help us improve Mozilla VPN by sharing crash reports, diagnostics, and product usage data. We never collect data about your online activity while using the VPN.
trans-unit.target: Help us improve Mozilla VPN by sharing crash reports, diagnostics, and product usage data. We never collect data about your online activity while using the VPN.

trans-unit.source: To install the VPN on another tablet or mobile device, scan the QR code.
trans-unit.target: To install the VPN on another tablet or mobile device, scan the QR code.

trans-unit.source: To install the VPN on another tablet or mobile device, scan the QR code. To install on a desktop computer, visit the Download page on the Mozilla VPN website.
trans-unit.target: To install the VPN on another tablet or mobile device, scan the QR code. To install on a desktop computer, visit the Download page on the Mozilla VPN website.

trans-unit.source: Install Mozilla VPN on up to 5 devices
trans-unit.target: Install Mozilla VPN on up to 5 devices

trans-unit.source: QR Code that links to the Mozilla VPN product page on the Google Play Store
trans-unit.target: QR Code that links to the Mozilla VPN product page on the Google Play Store

trans-unit.source: QR Code that links to the Mozilla VPN product page on the iOS App Store
trans-unit.target: QR Code that links to the Mozilla VPN product page on the iOS App Store

trans-unit.source: You can set Mozilla VPN to protect you from ads, trackers, and malware. Plus, customize your protection for specific apps.
trans-unit.target: You can set Mozilla VPN to protect you from ads, trackers, and malware. Plus, customize your protection for specific apps.

trans-unit.source: Protecting yourself is simple: tap to connect to the VPN and you’re ready to browse safely. Mozilla VPN will start automatically for seamless protection.
trans-unit.target: Protecting yourself is simple: tap to connect to the VPN and you’re ready to browse safely. Mozilla VPN will start automatically for seamless protection.

trans-unit.source: With more than 500 servers in 60 cities around the world, Mozilla VPN protects your data, browsing activity, and your true location from network spies.
trans-unit.target: With more than 500 servers in 60 cities around the world, Mozilla VPN protects your data, browsing activity, and your true location from network spies.

trans-unit.source: Use these features for more protection. They may cause issues on some sites, so you can turn them off anytime in settings.
trans-unit.target: Use these features for more protection. They may cause issues on some sites, so you can turn them off anytime in settings.

trans-unit.note: Accessibility read out for completed steps in the step progress bar. %1 is the name of the step. %2 is the index of the current step. %3 is the total number of steps.
trans-unit.source: Onboarding step “%1” (%2 of %3). Select to go back to this step.
trans-unit.target: Onboarding step “%1” (%2 of %3). Select to go back to this step.

trans-unit.note: Accessibility read out for the current step in the step progress bar. %1 is the name of the step. %2 is the index of the current step. %3 is the total number of steps.
trans-unit.source: Onboarding step “%1” (%2 of %3). You are currently on this step.
trans-unit.target: Onboarding step “%1” (%2 of %3). You are currently on this step.

trans-unit.note: Accessibility read out for incomplete future steps in the step progress bar. %1 is the name of the step. %2 is the index of the current step. %3 is the total number of steps.
Label for onboarding progress bar step where users find out how to install Mozilla VPN on other devices
Label for onboarding progress bar step where users can grant permission to create a VPN configuration with the system
Label for onboarding progress bar step where users can select to enable data collection
Label for onboarding progress bar step where users can select to enable various privacy settings
Label for onboarding progress bar step where users can select to enable VPN startup on device boot

trans-unit.source: Launch the VPN whenever you start your device. We’ll automatically reconnect you to the same server location you last used.
trans-unit.target: Launch the VPN whenever you start your device. We’ll automatically reconnect you to the same server location you last used.

trans-unit.source: Your mobile device will now ask you to allow Mozilla VPN to create a connection. Please allow this so that the VPN works correctly on your device.
trans-unit.target: Your mobile device will now ask you to allow Mozilla VPN to create a connection. Please allow this so that the VPN works correctly on your device.

trans-unit.source: Allow Mozilla VPN to create a VPN connection
trans-unit.target: Allow Mozilla VPN to create a VPN connection

trans-unit.note: Paragraph requesting the user to allow the VPN to run in the background.
trans-unit.source: To use Mozilla VPN, please allow it to run in the background.
trans-unit.target: To use Mozilla VPN, please allow it to run in the background.

trans-unit.note: Paragraph explaining how to enable the VPN to run in the background on macOS 14, see https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/mtusr003/mac for reference translations of these features on different versions of macOS.
trans-unit.source: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items of your System Preferences, and enable Allow in the background for Mozilla VPN.
trans-unit.target: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items of your System Preferences, and enable Allow in the background for Mozilla VPN.

trans-unit.note: Paragraph explaining how to enable the VPN to run in the background on macOS 15 and above, see https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/mtusr003/mac for reference translations of these features on different versions of macOS.
trans-unit.source: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items & Extensions of your System Preferences, and enable Allow in the background for Mozilla VPN.
trans-unit.target: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items & Extensions of your System Preferences, and enable Allow in the background for Mozilla VPN.

trans-unit.note: Paragraph explaining how to enable the VPN to run in the background on macOS 26 and above, see https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/mtusr003/mac for reference translations of these features on different versions of macOS.
trans-unit.source: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items & Extensions of your System Preferences, and enable App Background Activity for Mozilla VPN.
trans-unit.target: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items & Extensions of your System Preferences, and enable App Background Activity for Mozilla VPN.

trans-unit.note: Paragraph explaining how to enable the VPN to run in the background.
trans-unit.source: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items & Extensions of your System Preferences, and enable App Background Activity for Mozilla VPN.
trans-unit.target: In order to do this, please click the button below to open the Login Items & Extensions of your System Preferences, and enable App Background Activity for Mozilla VPN.

trans-unit.note: Label for the button that opens the login items settings page on macOS 14
Label for the button that opens the login items settings page on macOS 15 and above
Label for the button that opens the login items settings page
Title of the screen directing macOS users to allow the VPN to run in background
trans-unit.source: Allow VPN to run in background
trans-unit.target: Allow VPN to run in background

trans-unit.source: A fast, secure and easy to use VPN. Built by the makers of Firefox.
trans-unit.target: A fast, secure and easy to use VPN. Built by the makers of Firefox.

trans-unit.note: Appears on the in-app purchase view beside a subscription plan. "%1" is replaced by the percentage amount saved when selecting that plan
Button label
%1 is replaced by the subscription duration in months. %2 is replaced by the total subscription cost.

trans-unit.source: Please continue subscribing in your browser…
trans-unit.target: Please continue subscribing in your browser…

trans-unit.note: %1 is the user’s email address.
trans-unit.source: We couldn’t find a subscription for %1. Subscribe now to protect your connection.
trans-unit.target: We couldn’t find a subscription for %1. Subscribe now to protect your connection.

trans-unit.note: Body content of the screen where users go to reset the VPN to factory settings
trans-unit.source: This will reset all VPN settings, including:
trans-unit.target: This will reset all VPN settings, including:

trans-unit.note: Body content of the screen where users go to reset the VPN to factory settings
trans-unit.source: Resetting the VPN will sign you out, but your account will not be deleted.
trans-unit.target: Resetting the VPN will sign you out, but your account will not be deleted.

trans-unit.note: Body of the modal where users can confirm they want to restore back to factory settings
trans-unit.source: Reset Mozilla VPN settings? This can’t be undone.
trans-unit.target: Reset Mozilla VPN settings? This can’t be undone.

trans-unit.note: Label for button that finalizes a restore to factory settings
Title of the modal where users can confirm they want to restore back to factory settings
Item in a bulleted list denoting what will be deleted if the user opts to factory reset the client
Label for button that initiates a restore to factory settings
Label for button that takes the user to the factory reset flow
Title of the screen where users go to reset the VPN to factory settings

trans-unit.source: Sorry, we are unable to connect your Mozilla account to a current subscription. Please try again or contact our support team for further assistance.
trans-unit.target: Sorry, we are unable to connect your Mozilla account to a current subscription. Please try again or contact our support team for further assistance.

trans-unit.source: Sorry, we were unable to confirm your subscription. Please try again or contact our support team for help.
trans-unit.target: Sorry, we were unable to confirm your subscription. Please try again or contact our support team for help.

trans-unit.source: Another Mozilla account has already subscribed using this Apple ID. Please sign out and try again or contact our support team for help.
trans-unit.target: Another Mozilla account has already subscribed using this Apple ID. Please sign out and try again or contact our support team for help.

trans-unit.source: This server location is temporarily unavailable. Choose a new location.
trans-unit.target: This server location is temporarily unavailable. Choose a new location.

trans-unit.source: This server location is temporarily unavailable. Please open the app to choose a new location.
trans-unit.target: This server location is temporarily unavailable. Please open the app to choose a new location.

trans-unit.source: The server has been blocked. Check your firewall settings.
trans-unit.target: The server has been blocked. Check your firewall settings.

trans-unit.source: Get notified when connecting to a server location failed
trans-unit.target: Get notified when connecting to a server location failed

trans-unit.note: Label for recommended server list when the list is empty
trans-unit.source: To see recommended server locations, turn off the VPN.
trans-unit.target: To see recommended server locations, turn off the VPN.

trans-unit.note: Accessible label for the button that triggers a refresh of the recommended servers list.

The time (or in extremely rare circumstances, the date, day of the week, or "yesterday") which the recommended servers list was last updated and instructions to re-enable the refresh button. Argument is the time or date/day
trans-unit.source: Last updated: %1. To update this list please disconnect from the VPN.
trans-unit.target: Last updated: %1. To update this list please disconnect from the VPN.

trans-unit.note: The time (or in extremely rare circumstances, the date, day of the week, or "yesterday") which the recommended servers list was last updated. Argument is the time or date/day
Loading string while recommended servers are being calculated. Argument is the percentage of completion as an integer (i.e. 25)

trans-unit.source: No results. Try a different search
trans-unit.target: No results. Try a different search

trans-unit.note: Button label that reads out a city name whose connection is good. Argument is the city name.
Button label that reads out a city name whose connection is moderate. Argument is the city name.
Button label that reads out a city name whose connection is unavailable. Argument is the city name.
Button label that reads out a city name whose connection is poor. Argument is the city name.
Label for the “all” servers tab
Label for the “recommended” servers tab
Button label to clear all apps from the exclusions list
Appearance refers to the app theming (dark mode / light mode)
Automatic switching for dark mode/light mode, based on the system’s setting
Dark as in "dark mode theme"
Light as in "light mode theme"
This is the description of a checkbox option to allow the app to send crash reports without a user prompt
trans-unit.source: Allow Mozilla VPN to automatically send crash reports to help fix unexpected crashes
trans-unit.target: Allow Mozilla VPN to automatically send crash reports to help fix unexpected crashes

trans-unit.source: We couldn’t access your saved VPN settings. Please sign in again.
trans-unit.target: We couldn’t access your saved VPN settings. Please sign in again.

trans-unit.source: Resolve websites using a custom DNS
trans-unit.target: Resolve websites using a custom DNS

trans-unit.source: Invalid DNS, please try a new one
trans-unit.target: Invalid DNS, please try a new one

trans-unit.source: Changing these settings will cause the VPN to disconnect and reconnect automatically.
trans-unit.target: Changing these settings will cause the VPN to disconnect and reconnect automatically.

trans-unit.source: Resolve websites using Mozilla VPN’s standard DNS
trans-unit.target: Resolve websites using Mozilla VPN’s standard DNS

trans-unit.source: These options may cause some websites to break or not display content correctly.
trans-unit.target: These options may cause some websites to break or not display content correctly.

trans-unit.source: Turn off VPN for specific websites.
trans-unit.target: Turn off VPN for specific websites.

trans-unit.source: No more toggling your VPN on and off when you need a site to work. Plus, your preference for the website is saved so you don’t have to adjust it each time.
trans-unit.target: No more toggling your VPN on and off when you need a site to work. Plus, your preference for the website is saved so you don’t have to adjust it each time.

trans-unit.source: Get more precise control over how your VPN works when you’re browsing, with the Firefox extension.
trans-unit.target: Get more precise control over how your VPN works when you’re browsing, with the Firefox extension.

trans-unit.source: Choose different locations for different websites.
trans-unit.target: Choose different locations for different websites.

trans-unit.source: Browse one site as if you’re in New York and another as if you’re in Paris — all in the same Firefox session.
trans-unit.target: Browse one site as if you’re in New York and another as if you’re in Paris — all in the same Firefox session.

trans-unit.source: Reduces the number of ads you see when you’re using VPN
trans-unit.target: Reduces the number of ads you see when you’re using VPN

trans-unit.source: These options may cause some websites to break or not display content correctly.
trans-unit.target: These options may cause some websites to break or not display content correctly.

trans-unit.source: Helps protect you from ransomware, phishing, spyware, and viruses
trans-unit.target: Helps protect you from ransomware, phishing, spyware, and viruses

trans-unit.source: Fewer harmful domains will be able to track you
trans-unit.target: Fewer harmful domains will be able to track you

trans-unit.source: For your security, please sign in again to access your account information. You’ll complete this process on Mozilla’s website.
trans-unit.target: For your security, please sign in again to access your account information. You’ll complete this process on Mozilla’s website.

trans-unit.source: Help improve Mozilla VPN by sharing crash reports, diagnostics, and product usage data.
trans-unit.target: Help improve Mozilla VPN by sharing crash reports, diagnostics, and product usage data.

trans-unit.source: Mozilla VPN will launch and connect when you start up your device
trans-unit.target: Mozilla VPN will launch and connect when you start up your device

trans-unit.note: Startup refers to a device's startup, not the VPN client's.

trans-unit.source: VPN must be restarted to take effect
trans-unit.target: VPN must be restarted to take effect

trans-unit.source: Show or hide the developer options menu
trans-unit.target: Show or hide the developer options menu

trans-unit.source: Staging services are used to test features before they go live to production
trans-unit.target: Staging services are used to test features before they go live to production

trans-unit.note: Label for a checkbox that, if checked, will show the hidden "system/internal" apps. e.g. "Android Auto" is a system app on Android.
Displays inside the information card at the top of the Excluded apps screen when the VPN is on

Label for the upcoming date on which the subscription will expire.

Label for a button that will open the upgrade subscription flow.
Location in the systray. %1 is the country, %2 is the city.
Button label

trans-unit.source: We strive to provide you with choices and collect only the data we need to improve Mozilla VPN. Sharing this data with Mozilla is optional.
trans-unit.target: We strive to provide you with choices and collect only the data we need to improve Mozilla VPN. Sharing this data with Mozilla is optional.
